{% endraw %} {% raw %}

cxDictUniform[source]

cxDictUniform(ind1, ind2, indpb)

Cross over function that changes the corresponding value of two individual at the probability of indpb.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

cxBlender calculate $\gamma$ as: {% raw %} $$\gamma = (1+2\alpha)*\mathrm{random} - \alpha$$ {% endraw %}

{% raw %}

cxDictBlender[source]

cxDictBlender(ind1, ind2, alpha, fix_invalid=False)

Dictionary version of cxBlender.

Executes a blend crossover that modify in-place the input individuals. The blend crossover expects sequence individuals of floating point numbers.

  • alpha: Extent of the interval in which the new values can be drawn for each attribute on both side of the parents' attributes.
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

cxDictBlenderIfCan[source]

cxDictBlenderIfCan(ind1, ind2, alpha, indpb, fix_invalid=False)

A mixed version of cxDictUniform and cxDictBlender. For floating numbers, cxBlender will be applied; for other types, cxUniform will be applied.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
%%timeit
cxDictBlender({'C':3, 'lambda':3.11},{'C':5,'lambda':6.28},0.2)

1.27 µs ± 58.5 ns per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 1000000 loops each)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
cxDictBlender({'C':3, 'lambda':3.11},{'C':5,'lambda':6.28},0.2)

({'C': 3.177025447238911, 'lambda': 4.3965056802820195},
 {'C': 4.822974552761089, 'lambda': 4.993494319717981})
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
%%timeit
cxDictBlenderIfCan({'C':3, 'kernel':'rbf', 'lambda':3.11},{'C':5,'kernel':'poly','lambda':6.28},0.2,0.6)

2.38 µs ± 99.3 ns per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 100000 loops each)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
cxDictBlenderIfCan({'C':3, 'kernel':'rbf', 'lambda':3.11},{'C':5,'kernel':'poly','lambda':6.28},0.2,0.6)

({'C': 3.757746766165069, 'kernel': 'poly', 'lambda': 5.27818549500311},
 {'C': 4.242253233834931, 'kernel': 'rbf', 'lambda': 4.11181450499689})
{% endraw %}
